item.title: trading is simple bro you just have to notice a market inefficiency and then quantify it and then convert it to expected returns and then your estimate covariance matrix and then jam in your risk and turnover constraints and then

item.title: can someone from the discrete signal trading crowd tell me how they play poker? do they only call or fold? do they never raise? do they always bet the same size regardless of the pot odds? if that’s the case I would love to play heads up (25p/50p) DM open
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:

item.title: R to @quantymacro: ofc ppl like to prop up what they do (me included) to inflate their sense of importance but go outside your big cities and twitter and you’ll realise that if you take out the money you’ve made there’s nothing much left to you unfortunately. have a good weekend

item.title: I like what I do but unlike the tech/vc/pe/equity bros I’ll never pretend this job somehow makes you a deep critical thinker & a top G visionary philosopher that thrives in everyday life like cmon dawg we’re just pressing buttons gambling w someone else’s money its not that deep

item.title: some people say hedge fund-ers are devils and I think it’s true because the kitchen’s tap is consistently at maximum heat where the water literally burns and scalds your hands but all these mfers don’t seem to care

item.title:
Idk much abt “Super ratio”, but may I perhaps interest you in something called “Multivariate Linear Regression”? where you have multiple features as inputs & produce a single estimate of exp returns. also pls add ridge penalty.
follow me for more extremely advanced quant tips.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
Idk much abt “Super ratio”, but may I perhaps interest you in something called “Multivariate Linear Regression”? where you have multiple features as inputs & produce a single estimate of exp returns. also pls add ridge penalty.

follow me for more extremely advanced quant tips.

item.title:
I’m actually a very soft quant interviewer
> 95% of the qs will be based on what you wrote in CV > don’t ask brainteasers > don’t ask leetcode > don’t ask city you were born in > don’t ask first pet you had > don’t ask mother’s maiden name > don’t ask your name
you’re welcome
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
I’m actually a very soft quant interviewer

> 95% of the qs will be based on what you wrote in CV
> don’t ask brainteasers
> don’t ask leetcode
> don’t ask city you were born in
> don’t ask first pet you had
> don’t ask mother’s maiden name
> don’t ask your name

you’re welcome
